body.p: The cost of taking your pet aboard the air flight with you in the continental US varies according to the airlines. The five number summary for prices based on a sample of major U.S. airlines was:
Which of the following is true about this data?

input.choice: The lowest price is an outlier.
The highest price is an outlier.

response.feedback: Correct. The IQR is Q3 − Q1 = 125 − 100 = 25, so by the 1.5 IQR criterion, any observations below Q1 − 1.5 * IQR = 100 − 1.5 * (25) = 100 − 37.5 = 62.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 60 is below 62.5, 60 is an outlier.

Incorrect. The IQR is Q3 − Q1 = 125 - 100 = 25, so by the 1.5 IQR criterion any observations above Q3 + 1.5 * IQR = 100 + 1.5 * (25) = 125 + 37.5 = 162.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 150 is not above 162.5, 150 is not an outlier.

Incorrect. Given only the 5-number summary, it is impossible to determine which way the data is skewed. Even if we know there are outliers, we would need to know the mean or see the histogram to determine if there are outliers.

Incorrect. Given only the 5-number summary, it is impossible to determine which way the data is skewed. Even if we know there are outliers, we would need to know the mean or see the histogram to determine if there are outliers.

body.p: Based on the results of a nation-wide study, the number of contacts programmed into cell phones are summarized on the following boxplot:
Which of the following is true about this data?

input.choice: The lowest observation is an outlier.
The highest observation is an outlier.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The IQR is Q3 − Q1 = 125 − 50 = 75, so by the 1.5 IQR criterion, any observations below Q1 − 1.5 * IQR = 50 − 1.5 * (75) = 50 − 87.5 = −37.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 25 is not below −37.5, 25 is not an outlier.

Incorrect. The IQR is Q3 − Q1 = 125 − 50 = 75, so by the 1.5 IQR criterion, any observations above Q3 + 1.5 * IQR = 125 + 1.5 * (75) = 125 + 87.5 = 212.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 200 is not above 212.5, 200 is not an outlier.

Incorrect. Given only the 5-number, summary it is impossible to determine which way the data is skewed. Even if we know there are outliers, we would need to know the mean or see the histogram to determine if there are outliers.

Incorrect. Given only the 5-number summary, it is impossible to determine which way the data is skewed. Even if we know there are outliers, we would need to know the mean or see the histogram to determine if there are outliers.

Correct. The IQR is Q3 − Q1 = 125 − 50 = 75, so by the 1.5 IQR criterion, any observations below Q1 − 1.5 * IQR = 50 − 1.5 * (75) = 50 − 87.5 = −37.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 25 is not below −37.5, 25 is not an outlier. Similarly, any observations above Q3 + 1.5 * IQR = 125 + 1.5 * (75) = 125 + 87.5 = 212.5 are considered to be outliers. Since 200 is not above 212.5, 200 is not an outlier.
